name: Zahar King
headerTaglineThree: A digital marketing designer with a deep commitment to empowering communities, encouraging accessibility, and developing impactful solutions through a detail-oriented approach.

projects.title: CoHabit
projects.description: CoHabit is an social connections app driven to aid students in their search for the ideal first-time housemate.
projects.explanation: Designed a user-centered housing app that helps students find compatible housemates based on lifestyle, interests, and preferences. The project was developed during a 24-hour design sprint and includes comprehensive research, user flows, and high-fidelity prototypes.
projects.challenges: Delivering a comprehensive housing solution within a 24-hour timeframe while addressing complex matching criteria and ensuring a user-friendly interface that meets diverse student needs.
projects.results: Created a functional prototype that successfully addresses student housing pain points with an intuitive matching system and security features. The project won recognition for its user-centered approach and practical implementation.
projects.problemStatement:
75% of students struggle to find affordable housing options
40% of students struggle to find compatible housemates
91% of students struggle to find housing in a preferable location
As these ongoing issues often lead to stress and conflicts in the home, many students reported turning to Facebook groups or word-of-mouth to search for new housing options. However, these options are often unpredictable and unreliable due to lack of transparency in budgets, lifestyle habits, and housing preferences. Over time, living with incompatible housemates can negatively impact mental health and academic success, thus jeopardizing the wellbeing of thousands, lease after lease.
projects.solutionStatement: A platform driven to connect users based on similarities in lifestyle, personality, and interests rather than physical appearances offers every user a chance at finding their ideal match. Through phone and university email authentication, students can safely browse their matches without risk of scams or impersonators.
projects.designProcessOverview:
Empathize > Conduct Research, Interviews, and Surveys to understand student needs
Define > User Personas and Competitive Analysis to develop framework
Ideate > User Flow and Low Fidelity Wireframes to simulate user experience
Design > Visual Design and Prototypes to simulate user interface
Test > Usability Check to brainstorm improvements
projects.empathizePhase:
![CoHabit Project Timeline](/images/project1/CoHabit Project Timeline.png)
Interview Questions:
What year are you?
Where do you currently live?
Are you currently looking for a place to live?
What's your biggest challenge when searching for housing? (Select all that apply)
Have you had difficulties with housemates in the past?
What factors are most important in an ideal housemate? (Select your top 3)
What tools or features would make it easier to find student housing? (Select all that apply)
What are your top location preferences when choosing housing? (Select all that apply)
What is the biggest frustration you've had with student housing/roommates? (Open-ended response)

![CoHabit Survey Responses](/images/project1/CoHabit Survey Responses.png)

Key Insights:
High Value of Lifestyle Maintenance: Participants value their housemates sharing similarities in cleanliness, noise levels, and sleep schedules over compatibility in other areas, such as social life.
Prioritization of Personal Expectations: Many participants tend to move in with people based on their own personal needs before knowing whether or not their lifestyles are compatible.
Challenges in Knowledge of Housemates: Many participants cannot confidently predict what their lifestyle will look like upon moving in with new housemates.
Desire for a Comprehensive Platform: Participants seek a single platform that can seamlessly integrate a wide variety of tools to meet their personal, financial, and social needs.
projects.definePhase:
![CoHabit Competitive Analysis](/images/project1/CoHabit Competitive Analysis.png)
![User Persona 1](/images/project1/User Persona 1.png)
![User Persona 2](/images/project1/User Persona 2.png)
![User Persona 3](/images/project1/User Persona 3.png)
![Information Architecture](/images/project1/Information Architecture.png)
This information architecture provides a visual framework for organizing the platform's content, ensuring that users can easily navigate, access, and interact with the features that are crucial for their housing search experience. However, please note that the actual architecture of the app may have been further refined based on our user testing findings.
projects.designPhase:
![LoFi Sketches](/images/project1/LoFi Sketches.png)
![CoHabit Midfi Mockups](/images/project1/CoHabit Midfi Mockups.png)
![CoHabit Hifi Mockups](/images/project1/CoHabit Hifi Mockups.png)
projects.testingPhase:
Main Takeaways and Future Improvements:
Expanded Customization: Offer more room design options & customization tools to let users truly reflect their style.
AI-Driven Matchmaking: Implement AI to refine roommate matches based on deeper personality and lifestyle data.
More Location Filters: Add even more location preferences, like proximity to specific study spots, gyms, and social hubs.
Improved Chat Features: Integrate more engaging chat toolsâ€”think group discussions and video introductions!
Enhanced Subleasing & Marketplace: Create a robust marketplace for students to buy, sell, or swap furniture & essentials for a smoother transition.

projects.title: Pantry Zine
projects.description: A zine designed for the UC Davis Pantry to promote food security resources on campus
projects.explanation: Designed a visually engaging zine for The Pantry at UC Davis to inform students about food security resources available on campus. The zine includes information about how to access free food, and additional campus support services.
projects.challenges: Creating an approachable, stigma-free guide to food resources that students would feel comfortable using
projects.results: Increased student awareness of food security resources and boosted Pantry visitor numbers
projects.problemStatement: Students may be familiarized with The Pantry, but they may have holes in their knowledge about what who The Pantry is meant to serve, what resources we have available, and where we are located.
projects.solutionStatement: The Pantry Zine is meant to be an easy to access, physical resource where patrons and volunteers can flip through this short-form content at any time. The front cover is bright, colorful, and inviting, and each page of text is interspersed with fun imagery of nutritious foods to bring a sense of comfort and care to those that suffer from food insecurity.

carouselGroups.description: An updated version of the Pantry zine with additional content and refined design

projects.title: Craigslist Redesign
projects.description: A comprehensive redesign of Craigslist focusing on improved user experience and modern design principles
projects.explanation: Redesigned Craigslist to address usability issues and modernize the interface while maintaining the platform's core functionality and familiarity for long-time users.
projects.challenges: Balancing modern design with the simplicity that made Craigslist successful, while improving navigation and trust factors in the peer-to-peer marketplace.
projects.results: Created a more intuitive, visually appealing design with improved category navigation, search functionality, and listing visibility.
projects.problemStatement: Craigslist suffers from a very outdated interface that is difficult to navigate, lacks modern design elements, and fails to meet current user expectations. These issues, combined with concerns over safety and fraud, make users hesitant to engage with the platform, leading them to prefer alternatives like Facebook Marketplace.
projects.solutionStatement: By maintaining the white and purple aesthetic of Craigslist, this encourages familiarity and maintains a strong contrast. In utilizing a sans serif font, this appears professional and prioritizes legibility. In addition, the bold, dark purple color of headlines and primary buttons captures the user's attention and establishes hierarchy.

projects.title: Type Hierarchy Case Study
projects.description: An exploration of typographic hierarchy and composition principles through a series of design experiments
projects.challenges: Creating visual interest and clear information hierarchy using only typographic elements and limited color palette
projects.results: Developed a deeper understanding of typographic principles and created a series of compositions that effectively demonstrate visual hierarchy concepts
projects.introductionPhase: In this study, I was given a single set of text and was encouraged to explore compositional alternatives while expressing a clear hierarchy of the information.
projects.sketchProcessPhase: The rough sketches display my early compositions as I sifted through the various possibilities in my design.
projects.designConcepts: Throughout my design process, I thought about capturing the duality between Symmetry / Asymmetry, Rhythmic / Static movement, and Grouping / Isolation by creating emphasis using Contrast, Textures, Proximity and Grid structures.

projects.title: Marketing Strategy
projects.description: Comprehensive marketing approach for The ASUCD Pantry focusing on brand development and audience engagement
projects.explanation: Developed and implemented a comprehensive marketing strategy for The ASUCD Pantry, focusing on brand identity, messaging consistency, and audience engagement to effectively promote services and opportunities to the campus community.
projects.challenges: Creating a cohesive brand identity and marketing approach that resonates with a diverse student audience while maintaining consistency across various platforms and materials
projects.results: Established a recognizable brand presence, increased service usage, and improved community awareness of available resources through strategic marketing initiatives

projects.title: Rhythm Book
projects.description: A mini publication exploring visual rhythm and composition through typography and imagery
projects.explanation: Designed a conceptual mini-publication that explores the interplay between typography, imagery, and white space to create visual rhythm. This experimental book demonstrates principles of composition, pacing, and visual hierarchy in editorial design.
projects.challenges: Creating a cohesive visual narrative that balances experimental typography with readability while maintaining visual interest throughout the publication
projects.results: Produced a visually compelling publication that effectively demonstrates principles of rhythm, contrast, and balance in editorial design
projects.processStatement: This project began with extensive typographic research and exploration of grid systems. I developed a series of layout studies using different typographic treatments to create distinct rhythmic patterns across spreads, establishing a visual language that carries readers through the publication.
projects.conceptStatement: Rhythm Book explores how visual elements create cadence and flow in editorial design. By manipulating typographic scale, weight, spacing, and positioning alongside carefully curated imagery, the publication demonstrates how designers can control the reader's pace and experience.

carouselGroups.title: Rhythm Book Pages
carouselGroups.description: A complete walkthrough of the publication's content and design

projects.results: Produced high-quality print materials that increased visibility and engagement for campus programs and services

aboutpara: Hello, I'm Zahar. I'm a marketing and product designer with a deep commitment to empowering communities, amplifying voices, and creating impactful solutions through a detail-oriented approach.

resume.tagline: A marketing and graphic designer with a deep commitment to empowering communities, encouraging accessibility, and developing impactful solutions through a detail-oriented approach.
resume.description: I create impactful designs that combine aesthetics with functionality. My experience spans from branding and marketing to digital product design, with a focus on creating user-centered experiences that meet client goals.

experiences.position: Outreach Manager at The ASUCD Pantry
bullets: Hosted outreach campaigns for donation drives and educational events, driving engagement with local organizations and other campus groups
Designed promotional materials (flyers, merchandise, media), and infused original designs into base brand guidelines using Adobe Creative Suite and Canva
Directed marketing and media strategies to raise awareness of services and resources, boosting online engagement by 175% and reaching 2,000 accounts monthly
Led a team of coordinators in producing educational content and media projects that successfully reflect our mission and brand

experiences.position: Graphic Designer at Housing Advising for Undergraduate Students (HAUS)
bullets: Designed all promotional material to advertise services, upcoming events, and initiatives
Worked closely with directors all throughout the creative process, proofread all designs for errors before final deadlines
Independently developed brand guidelines and visual mock ups of projects while adhering to tight deadlines
Increased online visibility by 75% and garnered a 85% increase in campus-wide engagement
Assisted with event planning and co-hosted outreach events, fostering engagement with students across campus

experiences.position: Senator at the Associated Students of UC Davis (ASUCD)
bullets: Promoted senate initiatives and resources through tabling, conducting surveys, and designing promotional material
Drafted and passed senate bills to improve resource accessibility across campus
Collaborated with various committees, commissions, and units aimed at improving overall student welfare
Responded to student inquiries through office hours, town halls, and outreach events
Documented notes and public comments during all ASUCD listening sessions for student organization directors
